div.p: Snowed – I rode in carriage with George as far as L. Carpenters–
Cloudy – Mrs Beane left in 2–5 train for Fitchburg Lizzie + I rode with Geo. Mrs Bean's Sis. Butrick will be 86 years old tomorrow –
Lovely day – I rode alone around Mr Ame's Bar.ville + Jewelry Shop Corn–
Stormy all day —
Fornoon I took salt bath –
P.M. I rode with Geo. + Lizzie + met Mrs Beane at 3 train from Fitchburg
Text
Mr Wild went to Paw + Prov. to take up Deposits at Savg. Bks. for me —
I rode + was at Depot at noon –
Sister Mary came at night to my joy.
Very cold – I attended to preparations for Judge Bennett in the P.M. + then rode in forenoon –
After Dinnr laid down – Judge B. came at 2 1/4 and attended to the makig of my Will –

Still cold – I prep&ddotlow; for Mr Emerson my papers on Winter St. Papers on Policies +c – then rode and at noon was at cars to meet him, P.M. Had papers drawn up + directions given – Sister went Home in the mornng –
Yesterday was Fast for collegers – Mr Burnham of Fall Rivr was with the Semenst&sdotlow; a deep religious int. has begun –
At home as on Sab past —
Busy as we cld be in doing the last things – Mr Rogerson came and took chg of some business
P.M. Mrs Bean arranged my tings and Geo. packed them + Lizzie Wi I was very tired –

Cold but clear – I finished my business with Geo. + at 11 1/4 train Mrs B. + I left Home via Boston for Clifton Springs N.Y– Maggy was to leave in the P.M. + the House to be closed. We stop&ddotlow; at U.S. Hotel –

Cold – Left at 8 1/2 in Ex. Train for Albany – Saw Florence at Worcestr also Nellie Gould + Sln that was Gertrude Holbrook now Mrs Harding of Chicago with her Husband The last 2 Ladies were pupils at Semy. in 1858– Stop at Delavan House–

Cold day – Left the Delavan House at 8–45 in Drawg. Car for Syracuse 148 where we Exchang&ddotlow; cars for Clifton Springs 64 mls. Thro the Mohak Valley Snow very deep – But after leavg Syracus not Much snow – stop at Foster House– Room 5 –
Clifton Springs Ontario Co. N.Y —
Cold day – Mrs. B + Susie Plympton went P.M. to Bible Class Chapel — after which I walkd with Mrs Bean.
Bitter cold day– I went to See Dr Prince at the Sanitarium + put myself under his care —
P.M. walk&ddotlow; with Mrs Beane.
Most rigorous day we have felt –
Snowing + blowing and impossible to keep warm –
Eugene Chapin + Janine Draper came about 9 morng. + left about 3 P.M.
Mrs. Bean at Eve sick from chills + bowel ca
Moderated — + quiet air – I took my first bath (salt) this morng. Enjoyed it much.
walked alone – Mrs B. sick tho. has been to take first salt bath –
Howling kind of day – Mrs B. confined to the room – tho. some better – at 4 P.M. I took salt bath – heat did not go out only to the San&ndotlow; Eve. + night cold in our room –
Some sunshine –
Mrs B. still sick.
4 P.M. took my first Electro chem bath –
At 11 took Salt Bath —
Mrs Beane Still sick – + meals in her room –
I walkd 40 mins. P.M.
Zero.
>I went to Chh. for first time since Augst. last.
P.M. walkd – 43 mns
Mrs B. went down to tea for first time since Wed.
Walked in forenoon then laid down after dinnr– at 3 3/4 took Electro Chem. Bath pretty hot + sever– came over a freshly washed floor + took cold — Chilly in Eve – + sore flesh –
Not feeling well quite Dr sent me something for Chill – felt better + at 4 1/2 walked out with Mrs Bean
Took no Salt water Bath to day —
A tedious day – Suqalling + windy – I took salt Bath at 11 – was tired aftr + slept – wrote Sister Mary– 8 pages —
Lovely day —
Saw Dr Prince in morng. then took Salt Bath. Rather weak after bath –
At 4 1/2 P.M. Mrs B. + I walked — 35 mins
Eve. We calld into Mrs Stockings Room.
after breakfast we went to Parlor + heard Lowell from my Study window on "Foreigners" – then heard Dutch Rep. awhile – then took Salt rub –
Cold — Took Elec. Chem. Bath at 11–20–
P.M. Mrs Bean + I walked —
Clear + cold –
Went to Chapel morng. + heard Rev. Mr Bodwell on John 14–9 How I been so long time with you +c – Enjoyed it very much
Walkd at noon and at 4 1/2 P.M. read a good deal —
Milder – melting in the St. went for Salt rub — about 10 1/2 – Headachy + P.M. neuralgis out my farn –
walked with Mrs Bean – in P.M.
Eve. in Parlor with som company —
Very mild – went into gymnasium at 11–20 took Elec. Bath – Headachy and P.M. + Eve almost sick –
Mrs Thatcher calld in the Eve. Methodist ministers wife from Chicago
Had a feverist night but better to day —
Did not go out doors—
Still very mild + rather drizzly – Thunder + lightning last night – I took Salt bath at 10 3/4—
P.M. wrote Mr. Emerson on business –
Went to Salt Water bath after seeing Dr Prince–
P.M. walked with Mrs Beane – It was cold + wind pursing
Cold – took Elec. Ch. Bath – Mrs Bean took her first Turkish Bath –
P.M. about 5 we walked 20 minutes –
Mr Wm. Foster returnd this forenoon from Fla.
Snow Storm all day
I went for Salt Bath + when all ready my sheet cld. not be found – So I did not take one –
Sent letter to Sister Mary + ck. for Mary Fox.
Snow flakes falling a little – some 4 or 5 inches Snow fell yes. I took Elec. Chem. Bath about 11–45 Morng — Almost blistered by Iodine –
I walk about 5 with Mrs Bean–
I walked nearly half hour before bathing Had Salt bath – by Julia
It soon began to Drus + continued to till I went to bed —
Eve. Mrs Beane went to parlor for Social gathering —
Pleasant – Some 14 in. snow – Mild – I took Salt rub + then walked 1/2 hour –
Eve. Mrs Stocking came in + sat with us She had no fire in her room –
I went to see Dr Prince and then to bath room for salt rub — Mary gave it – P.M. I walked 35 mins with Mrs B — Eve went in a little while to parlor to hear a Mrs Sentre sing Ballads –
Mild + thawing some – I went to salt bath and Mrs B. to Turkish Bath – I walked alone after my bath up west road –
P.M. we finished the Old Man s Sellers Secret Transl. from German
Eve. Mrs Ban gone to female prayer meetg
Pleasant – went to Chapel in forenoon – Com. Season – The first I have Enjoyed for 8 mos – at 4 1/2 went to Ladies Miss. Meeting – Letters from Miss&sdotlow; read —
Mr Foster very sick –
Went to salt bath in morng.
I went to Elec. Chem. bath – Had a nice one – Walked in P.M.
Eve. Mrs Bean + others went to San. for entertainment — I at home – reading —
Felt rather stiff as if I had taken cold. but went to Salt bath + then walked —
P.M. Miss Bowery Teacher So. Hadley calld—
Lovely day — Had Salt bath – + then walk with Mrs Bean –
P.M. Sent off 3 lettrs
Eve. we read while others went to San. for amusement –
Raind last night + Snow wasting– Mrs Bean headache — I took salt bath – then walkd
Had letter from Sis. Mary + wrote her P.M—
Mrs Stocking + Daughter left this morng. Took Elec. Chem. Bath
P.M. Mr + Mrs Hogarth left –
Pleasant —
Heard Prof. Condit from Auburn Theo. Sey at Chapel from He hath made all things beautiful in his tim or its season – I had two walks –
Snow melting fast
Had Salt Bath Two walks —
P.M. rained some but we calld at Mrs Howe door alt Miss Bowery saw Mrs Prof Smith in Library – Eve. calld on Mrs Thacher —
Brook very high–
Very mild in forenoon – walkd on San. grounds – then took Elec. Chem. Bath – Little Bickerstein died 11 clk. A.M. + taken away at 4 1/2 to N.Y.
Eve. we called on Mrs Howe – grows cold — I walkd P.M
An inch of snow fell last night + it is very cold + windy –
I took Salt baths – P.M. I wrote 2 letters — I did not walk –
Eve. several Ladies in our room –
Very cold + windy – Took Salt Bath
P.M. Mrs B. + I walkd
at 7,o'clk but moderated fast – Lovely day – Susie Plympton left for N.Y. 6–47 train.
I took Salt Bath – and then walk&ddotlow; Eve. we call'd on Miss Scull –
Snow Storm all day –
Mrs Howe calld in the morng. Mrs Dayton with Baby – I went to Elec. Chem. Bath –
Pleasant – went to Church in. morng. A stranger 65 yrs. old perhaps preached – Rather slow – but I enjoyed Mr Bodwells prayer,+ the Hymns –
Mrs B. + I walked after Service – Mrs B. went to the Methodist in Eve.
Pleasant – I saw Dr Prince + took Salt bath in forenoon – Had a large mail – + wrote to Geo. on business– then Mrs B. + I walk Eve. Miss Thompson call'd–
Very cold last night but beautiful suny day – I took Elec. Ch. bath and P.M. laid down for a long nap after wh. Mrs B. + I walked – Eve Mrs Hudson + Mrs Doris calld — My arm very bad from letters —
Cloudy + raw – Mrs Foster call&ddotlow; in morng. I took Salt bath – + saw Dr Prince – then walked — P.M. wrote Sister Mary + began a letter to Jane Pean–

Snowed 2 inches depth last night – but play out – My arms are so swollen I suspend Baths for the present. Mrs Field of Louisville Ky. call&ddotlow; in our room after dinner – Eve. Mrs Howe called – a reader of paper at Sanitarium
Cloudy mrong. I walked at 11 – and it soon began to rain after I came in – no bath to day – arms some better but still badly swollen —
Pleasant
Mr + Mrs Foster went to her Father's — to Dine –
Salt Bath – I took omthing on ret. of letters–
Walked – Mrs B took Turkish Bath
Pleasant – walked in forenoon + was so tired did not go to Chh. till Eve when I went to Meth. Sab. Cow&traise;
Lovely day – took Salt Bath and then walked with Mrs B – –
Pleasant – Took Elec. Chem. after seeing Dr Prince. It irritated my skin very much
Pleasant – I had a bad night from State of Skin– Saw Dr P. with Mrs Howe He ordered a bath specially prepared at 3 1/2 P.M. wh. soothd me –
Pleasant – Mrs B.has headache + is feeble – I had a good nights sleep tho. did an amt. of scratching —
Entertainment at the Cure–
Began raining in the night + continud thro. the day – Saw Dr Prince in morng P.M. took fresh watr Bath – Expected Miss Kilham but she has not come.
Snow Enough last night to cov groud Pleasant – no bath to day –
Eve went to female prayer meeting — at Chapel —
Pleasant + mild Rev. Mr Tracy of Sutton preached in the morng. Prof. Loomis of Mead Smiry Pa. in the Eveg – 1rst Sermon on Hean Rv. 22–3,4,5– Eve. on Paul —
Pleasant – took Sulphur bath for the first time – It allayed the itching –
P.M. we walked toward "Rocky run"–
Pleasant = saw Dr Prince – took 2d Sulp. Bath –
Pleasant—
Took Sulp. bath–

We prep&ddotlow; to go to Geneva in 9.22 train but the clouds were so threatening we gave it up. Even the little effort to get ready and to mail two paprs for home fatigued me for the day – tho I wal.d + had Sulp. bath
walked in morng. then saw Dr Prince – Rained for an hour or so – I took Sulp. bath at 11 1/4 –
P.M. Mrs Haine + Miss Scull called. after wh. we walkd then tea — then we called on Mrs Apthorpe
Lovely day — walk&ddotlow; in morng. Sulp. bath at 11 – then a nap. A letter from Sister Mary—
another walk

Pleasant – Mrs B. + I went to hear the Universalist min. a young man – decnt and interesting – Text Gal. 6 +14 – Hymns Watts mostly – We walked – A Miss Olmsted died at the cure this morng. Suddently from Ct. —
Pleasant – Bath in forenoon of Sulphur
at 4" set out for Rocky Run – 1 mile out + back on R.R. – I was not very tired –
Rain + Snow thro. the day —
Bath of Sulp. at 11 — after seeing Dr Prince
I had replies from ap&sdotlow; for Board at Catskil Eve. in Parlor with Mrs. Com. Swift +Hus. + Miss Scull –
Cloudy, lourey Mong. but we walked a half hour – then to Sulp. Bath —

Cloudy but no rain and Mrs B. + I went to Geneva – Rode about the Town – passed Com. Swift's residence – He + his wife have been stopping at our Hotel – we took a room at the Franklin House and dined there – + ret&ddotlow; P.M quite tired –
I am tired from my trip to Geneva – Saw Dr Prince – + then took Sulphur bath –
P.M. walked – Com. Swift + Wife ret&ddotlow; home to day –
very cold and chilly walking –
Walked in morng — Took Sulp. bath at 11 – It soon began to snow – This is the 29&th; birth day of Mrs Thatcher – We all took some little note of it and Surrounded her dinner plate with little gifts –
Very cold – Squalls of snow after 12 at noon – I went to Chapel– Mr Bodwell text Mal.3.14 f. C. – good – I walked twice –
Ground cov&ddotlow; with snow and quite cold – then melted + Snowed by turns all day — I took Sulp. bath at 11–
This is the Centenial of the first gun fired against the Eng.
Still very cold tho. fair weather. Saw Dr Prince this mong. then took Sulp. Bath.
P.M. Mrs Field called I then went to funeral of Mr McMillen – my laundress Husband —
Cold – We walked twice + I rode in omnibus – Feel tired + nervous – Took sulph. bath –
Eve Mrs Bean went at Eve. to hear the Peak Family!
Still cold but not quite So Severe –
I took Sulp. bath. Had a letter from Mary Abbie —
Miss Scull + Miss Dayton
Raw + disa walked in morng.
Saw Dr Prince took sulp. bath Walked P.M. and found it milder went to Cemetry
Snow 5 or 6 in deep – by noon
Sulp. Bath at 11 1/2 walked a little while before tea
Pleasant but cold – I feeling languid walkd in forenn + about 4 – Did not go out till Eve. Servi at Chapel – Mr Edsn Epis. preached –
Rose languid—
Walked about 9 1/2 + then rested — P.M. I wrote + after getting then walked to Laundry Did not take bath I felt so languid –
Very pleasant – Saw Dr Prince Took Sulp. Sponge + walkd twice
Lovely – No Bath cleaning Bath R.
P.M. I rode with Mrs Hadn to PhElps
Eve. calld on Mrs Dayton + Daug.
Pleasant forenoon foreno mild – No Bath still cleanig B.R.– P.M. we drove out to Sodus R.R. crossing when rain drove us back – very windy night
Still windy but + cloudy – I took Sulp. Sponge – after tea Mrs B. + I walkd + then went to meeting at San.
Cloudy + toward rain set in—
I walked in morg. after Sulp. Sponge
P.M. Mrs Thatchr called –
Disagreeable day from wind + cold– I was at the Chapel Service in morng. A Mr Bissell adminstrd the Sacrament in Epis. Methodist fore it was solem – we went at Eve. + heard Mr Bodwell
Still cold + windy – We walked twice + went to Milbirur
I took Sulp. sponge

Milder – Lovely day. Mr + Mrs H.O. Apthorp left for home (Cambridge this morng. The Son Leonard daughter Grace remain two weeks longer – I saw Dr P. + took Sulp. Sponge — Dr Foster + wife returned to day –
Pleasant – We drove out in Comp&zdotlow; with Mrs Hudson over the "outlet" round Rocky Run." — very tired
Rained in the night + dark lowery morng. — Cleared by noon – We walked + I took Sulp. Sponge walked after for my headache — Eve. worse + nausea – bad – —
Bilious – had sick headache last night – P.M. rode to Phelps with Mrs Bean –
Warmer then it has been – I busy in varis things – Settled with Mr Hudson + went to Bath Maids and said good bye — after we got our new Bonnets – in night thunder storm
78° at noon —
Very warm – We wet to Chapel morng. to hear Mr Bodwell on the Scripture
Eve. to hear Prof. Loomis If C. be not risen then we are of all men most miserable – –
Thunder storm in the night + rain — at 8 went to see Dr Foster by apt&nraise; and have decided to delay going home – Took Electro Thermo. Bath –
Clear + bright – we drove out in our hired Buggy – Mr + Mrs Foster fell in company with us – we came near beig run down by Cars – came home by "outlet" road — Took Hot Sulp. Bath —
Rained in the night and showered to day – I took Salt Bath at 4 P.M. saw Dr Fosters –
Eve Mrs Field Phil&adotlow; called –
Beautiful day — I took Elec. Thermo. at 11–20–
P.M. at 3 we drov out round outlet till 5 –
Eve called on Eldr Drayton
Mild but cloudy I walked up west Hill –
Took hot Sulp. Bath Had letter from Geo. P.M. drove an hour but it began to rain –
Showery–
I took Salt Sponge
P.M. walked and got Eng. violets at Mrs Fares–
Mrs Hudson + Maid retd from Buffalo
Bright cool day. We heard Jonathan L. Jenkins – Amherst Mass. on conscin A very good sermon At 130 we went to Dr Foster's bible class — on resisting Evil – Eve. after our walk Mrs B. went to Chapel –
Bright + cool —
Went in morng. to dress maker – there ripd Blk. Silk. on going to Elec. Thermo. found the room in Painters hands – after dinner wrote letters and at 3 drove out – + at 10 of 5 had Salt Sponge
Lovely day —
Took Hot Sulp. Bath Tried on Basque at Miss Abed's —
P.M. drove out with Mrs B. in comp. with Mrs Hudson + Mrs T.E. Field around Coon'sville
Pleasant tho. cloudy – Mrs T.E. Field left here for L.D.Rice's Saratoga – at noon took Elec. Thermo. Bath – at 3 we went out + drove 2 hours.
Pleasant – took Hot Sulp. Bath –
P.M. drove round Foster Farm
Eve. Mrs Hudson calld with Eddy —
Very warm – I very weak in abdomen– Saw Dr Foster—
Took Salt Bath –
4 1/2 Mrs Bean drove out with Miss Bowers
Warm + pleasant – Took Elec. Thermo. + rode in P.M. an hour or So – quite tired –
Very warm — I staid all day in the house to recuperate –
92d in shade—
Thunder storm about 3 this morng. but cleared off + is clear + hot–
I took Sulphr– Salt Sponge –
Saw Dr Foster + he orderd Elec. Chem. Bath wh. I took —
Trunks packed + last things done for leavig in the morng. for Home
Left Clifton Spa. 6–47 – via Syracu + Albany for Springfield where we spent the night —
Left Springfield about 7 1/2 for So. Framingham where we took B.C. + F. road to Mansfield + Enute Norton 12–10– Went to Hotel + dinned –
P.M. went to our House + Mrs Boyentn is to send in our meals —
Feeble and good for little Exertion
Same –
Same —
Mrs Bean went to Boston + did shopping for us both —
Rainy morng. Mrs Bnj Briggs her sweeping – Mrs Babbit in + out fitting dresses –
Cleared off–
Cloudy – Mrs B. + I left in 11 –20 train for Bos – took carriage + did some busins at 3 1/4 we went out to Judson's – Found Brighm Goldthwait there + Juin Toby came.
Rainy – Mrs B. wnt into City at 8 + I at 10 – She did Errands + Staid till 2 Train + I came out at 11–10–
Raind very hard at Eve
Mrs Briggs here + did up sweeping – thoroughly –
Mrs Babbitt in–
All very busy –
Packing done –
after tea called at Mr Atkinsons a momnt.

Arranged Every thing I could – + at 11 AM. left with Mrs Bean for Lane's Depot Enroute for Ux. via Prov ar&ddotlow; at Ux – 3–10– Found Adol. had paralysis of the brain the day befre He is insensible—
Rained last night + Early this morng. Adol – Still insensible– Had water drv in morng. —
I at home not able to go to Chh—

Pleasant – Sister Mary took me to ride – after wh. Saw Adol + he he knw me – His face radiant with joy – says "I am so glad to see you – so glad to see you." – It is only by intervals that he knows any one.
Pleasant – Bro. Adol restless = up + down – Intervals of reason –
I had two walks + felt better for them
Very pleasant –
I walke twice and was very smart–
Feeling tired + good for nothing –Adol. failing – Saw him twice–
This is Bunker Hill Centennial – a pleasant day –
Rainy day – Saw Bro. Adol. this mong He is failing – very suffering – Have written 3 or 4 letters
Saw Adol. again – He is quite low –

Rained considerably thro. last night – About ten last Eve there was a Bd. Hous burned down at Ux. woolen Mf. Company Co
– from Explosion of Kerosene lamp — Adol seems unconscious –
Later – died at 3 1/2 P.M.
A quiet Sab.= our dear Bro. sleeps – a blessed sleep –
Sis. Mary went to Chh. in P.M.
Bro. Judson came about 11. AM. not hearig that Adol. was at rest. tho. telegraph Sat Eve –
Sis. Mary very feeble –
Pleasant – Sis. Ema came at 11 1/2 — Funeral at 2 P.M. Mr Biscoe + Dr Abott present – + Ux relativs – I present at the House but did not go to the grave –
Spent the night at Cynthia's + breakfasted there –
Had 2 walks – Think I am ganig.
Very hot – Spent last night at Cynthias + breakfasted this morng. went to P.O then wrote 4 business letters —
Sister Mary took Cynthia, May Abbe + myself out on a drive of 2 hours The scenry was lovely but I got quite tired –
I went to Chh. in morng. + heard Mr Thursting of Whitinsville – was rather disappointed in him–
Adol. 2d Sab. in Heavn!
Very warm – but I can walk and get strength by it –
Still warm –
Mary Abbie left in the 1–20 train for Norton for the great Reunion — Our house open for lodging friends and take their meals at Mrs Boynton's – Mr Atkinson died this m. at 5,o'clk.
This the 40&th; ann. of Wheaton Seminy – I here at Sis. Marys away from the Confusion – 25&th; ann. of Mrs Metcalf's administratn –
Sis Mary + Will&ddotlow; took tea with me at Mary Seagravs + I went over the new House.

I left Uxbridge in the 11 Express – had to stay in Prov till 3 1/4 + then at Mansfield till 5 1/2 train tr came – Found Marth Holmes, Hus. + Frankie at our House + Ellen – I have gained greatly since I left 3 weeks ago —
Pleasant – got tired by seeig friends and talking busins
Mr + Mrs Holmes + Franky left for Cars at 6–25 Enroute to Paxton –
Very warm –
Danl. S. Cobb. called to get mony to settle Pastor sal
P.M. we rode to Bridget's about wash —

I went to Chh. in morng. and worsh&ddotlow; with our own dear people – The first time for about 1 year – The pulpit drap&ddotlow; in back for our Pastor – P.M. Com. Season but I did not go – Mr Langworth preached
Very warm – 4 of July fire cracks
Nellie Bean packig
Some rain at Eve thunder + lighting
Morng. sultry + som thunder + lightnig —
Nellie left in 8–20 Train for Haverhill N.H.

p.del: Took tea at Mary Seagrav's and lookd over the House new + delightful views

div.p: Mrs Beane + I left in 8–20 train via Boston for Princeton where we ar&ddotlow; at 6 1/2 P.M. via Bos. Gardns + Barre R.R. and some 2 1/2 or 3 mls by coach – Obtained rooms at Dea. Nelson Howards next to Wachusett Hous
Pleasant, pleasant pleasant! We are delighted with our House + the place – never in any vacation was I so pleased –
Eve. Mrs Cominrs + Daughter ard. from Bos. Highlands
Pleasant – I have begun my walks and my strength is returning fast – air invigoratig –
Eve. a Mrs Bartlett child + nurse – + her Father Mr Buffern of Brooklyn N.Y–
74d– in my room –
A lovely day – Mrs B. + I in morng. walked up Wachuset Hill –
Globe came this morng.
Perfect day —
Walked mong + P.M. and went to Chh. in morng. + heard Mr Howe's first anneveary sermon – I thankd God + took courage–

div.opener:
65° at 5 in my room
Monday, July 12, 1875.
div.p: Clear + beautiful rose at 5 – wrote Anie G.C. and took it to office and then walkd half hour — walkd again before tea Perfect weather —
Still another perfect morng – 66&draise; –
P.M. about 4 1/2 it rained a half hour
I have bal&ddotlow; my Bank + Cash Books to my great joy – a letter from Mrs Met. at Eve. written in the morng. —
Hottest day I've felt in Princeton – In mong Mrs B. + I went to Dea Fay's to the circulatry Library –
A Mrs Dr Adams 2 children + Svt. ar&ddotlow; Her Hus. came with them to leave in the morng. from Waltham

Still another pleasant day – I feel rather steep&ddotlow; from my walk yesterday – I took a short walk on Fitchburg Road – and after tea we are in love Lane = Mrs Brindly + Daughter from came to board –
A drizzly morng. + drizzly day —
I walked in forenon to Boylston Res. from P.O. P.M. kept in House – was dyspeptic and Eve. very nevs as I have not been for 4 or 5 weeks –

Bright + breezy – We walked to Mrs Asinalt Eveleth's to get her palm leaf Baskets – a walk going + coming 2 1/4 mls. Tired – but better than stay in doors – Better in health to day – The Lord make me better in soul –
Rainy day – We went to Chh. in forenoon – Text "keep thy heart with all diligence – for out of it are the issues of life"– Compd it to a fountain –
Beautiful day – mrg we walked up "Sunset Hill"– with Mrs Aylsworth The view was grand – Repeated it after Tea –
Wrote a long letter to Sister Mary –
Another pleasant day – about 9 1/2 I walk&ddotlow; past the Russl place and beg&ddotlow; some straws of Barley growig luxuriantly – tired with the walk — + lazy to day – Readig Charlotte Bronte –
Hazy, cold morng. but Sun came out hot – We walk&ddotlow; to Boylston Cemetery in the morng. – a letter from Geo. + Miss Carter –
Eve. Sat. in parlor with the Ladies–
Pleasant – 65° on rising – walk&ddotlow; after breakfast toward cemetery – a letter from Mrs Met.
Annie Chapin called — after tea.
Very rainy day – old fashion rain storm
Pleasant – Mrs Metcalf ard. at 2 P.M. to pass a week – We were glad to see her – Mrs B. moved up to 3d story room – + Mrs M. rooms with me –
Pleasant we 3 went to Chh. Mr Howe's text Tho shalt love the L. thy G. with all thy heart – Earnest sermon Eve. we went to Praise meeting.

Pleasant – but warm for P. Ther. went up to 80&linedeg; Mrs Beane went out with the Misses Carpenter of Naragansett Pier to E. Sterling to the pottery – Mrs Met. wrote letters + I had my two walks – P.M. Mrs M. drove to Mt. House –

Sprinkled in the morng. but cleard off + Mrs Metcalf went to Jaffrey to see a Miss Cutter – Mrs B. + Mrs Aylsworth + I walk&ddotlow; in the woods – P.M. I walk&ddotlow; to Boylston Place Dr Adams came last night to see his baby– She is better to day.
70° at 7– mong in my room– Hazy morng.
Pleasant but cool morng. + Eveg– Hot sun mid day –
Marhsal P. Wilder + Daughter call&ddotlow; on Mrs Metcalf –
Pleasant – Mrs Metcalf left in 11 1/4 train for Lancaster via Worces
Mrs B. + I walkd to Libray —
Eve. House filed with strangers –

Lovely cool day – our House full – We heard Rev Dr Putnam preach Text Luke 22&draise; 61 f. c. a touchig sermon – He is Uni. from Brooklyn NY – only on idea or sentimt I wld. not adopt – "We all have in us a germ of goodness that will lead to the Drie"
Cloudy morng. Miss Ellen Terry has left for Holderus N.H. for the remainder of her vacation – Others also went – Rain set in about 3. Ive been cold all day till since dinner
Rainy continug and cold storn
Mrs George Brinley of Hartford + Daught Ellen + Son George left here int 11 1/2 coach + Mrs B. + I moved into their room – for Augst. Mr Comins left in 4 1/4 Coach –
There was breaks of sun shine but som sprinkling –
Milder – Eve sulty
Sultry– very– sun hot –.
A Mrs Edwards + 2 dughters cam Eve + took the chamber we vacated–
Very sultry– 74d— Ive felt the heat very much –
Very warm forenoon went to Chh. morng. Mr Howe's text "a man above Evry name"–
Mrs Edwards + two daughters came last night friday –
P.M. some cooler or less hot —
Less hot – comfortable I walk&ddotlow; in the morng. to Boyl. Hou + at 5 to Libray –
A letter from Annie C. She went home last week –
More comfortable than any day for a great while – Bright + beautiful – Miss Edwd Sister have driven over to Lancaster – I walked to Boyl. H. with Mrs EdwrdA.M. + P.M. in Love Lane.
Sultry in our room. walked to the "Shed House" and again
Mrs Aylsworth ret&ddotlow; this Eve.
Mrs Beane rode with Mrs Edwards I walked in mong. Eve Mrs B. + I calld on the Wilders —
Pleasant – but warm –Mrs Bean sick in the night + to day till near noon – Then revived + went with me to Fair —
Mrs + Miss Adams came to day –
Pleasant – but very dogdaysy– The most uncomfortable day sinc I came to me.
Mrs B. staid for Chh. I went – Mr Howe's text "a soft answer turneth away wrath–
Cloudy till noon when it began to rain Mrs Hixon + Miss Wilder called. I walked with the latter to Boylston pl. –
Eve. Charades + Tableux
M.A.Chapin cam this morng. 9–50—
Cloudy all day looking like ran This Eve a Sea fog set in –
Wrote Ema
Walked with Mrs B. + Mary + Mrs Persons
Sun rose bright but grew hazy– + during P.M. rained hard – I walk&ddotlow; turn Miss Sherman came at Eve. – after wh. there was a Mother Goose party in parlor
No rain this forenon but P.M. it poured for an hour or so – I walked in morng. with Miss Sherman
A lovely day – Sister Cynthia came about 11 A.M. to my joy – At 2 Several of the Boarders went to Wachusett Mt. Mrs Bean + Mary Abbie went –
Pleasant – rather cool – we went to Chh. Mr Howe's text – He Paul preachd of Right. temp. + Judgt very good Sermon — P.M. rained heavily – grew cool at night.

Pleasant – tho. rather cloudy– very cool – 14° colder than yesterday I walked after breakst with Mrs Edward&sraise; + Ema Sherman – Mrs Bean + rode with the Edwards in morng. + in P.M. Cynthia Mary + Ema rode to Mt. + then Mrs Bean + I rode —
Lovely day – Sis. Cyntha + May left in the mong. Mr Wild + Ellen W. Ben came in 10 clk. train Mr W. ret&ddotlow; at 4 P.M.
Evg. we all met in Parlor for guessing–
Still pleasant – Nell. + I went to Library –
P.M.Nell. rode to Sterling Junction with Edwards –
Lovely day – Warmer – The Aylsworths left this morng. – I walkd to the grange–
Warm but lovely — We all went to Chh. Mr Howe's text– Ezk. 26 –26 – Heart of stone –
We went to Praise meeting at Evg.
Another pleasant day– Warm.
It is regarded the warmest of the season — –
I hired carriage and Mrs Bean + Nellie + Miss Eds&ddotlow; drove around the Mt.
Change to cooler weather – Early this morng. A lovely day —
Mr Erskine Phelps fo Chicago came at Evg. the son of Mrs Edwards – f— Mr Bartlett came in the morng.
Perfect weather – Mrs Bean + Nellie rode to Stirling Junc. for Phebe Edwards. I walked partly up Sun set Hill – feel tired + weak–
Awoke some sick so I could not rise thro. the day – to be dressed – a billious turn – Took scarcely anything
The Cormines, Edwardes, Ema Sherman + on or two others left in the morng. 10 prs
I sent for Dr West– He shot. I needed building up rather than phyicing– orderd Citrater of magnesia – 1 or twice a day as needful – also Quince + Lager –
Eve. Sally Adams rst&ddotlow;
Ret&ddotlow; our first room I feeble + could do nothing about mving. Dr West in to see me.
P.M. Floren cam at Eve –
I feeling feeble + keeping my Room —
Mrs Bean + Daugher went to meetig. MissesPendleton + Mary Carpenter went up Wachusett—
Pleasant tho. it raind in the Early morng. Flo. + Nellie left in 5 1/2 morng. Coach + Mr + Mrs Austin Summers + Son at 7 3/4 Coach – I still keept my room till tea when I went down –

Pleasant— Took my first walk since my illness up to Wach&tdotlow; House
Dr West calld
Miss Pendleton left for Taunton in 4 Coach
Pleasant — Am tring C. Brook Spg. water Cwith benefit–
The Bufferns and Bartletts left this morg. so we are reduce&ddotlow; to 5 ladies –
Very warm
Rain began about noon – Quite windy – + disagreeable for a Temperance Meeting here –
Has become very cool –
Pleasant but cool I heard reading young Folks U.S. His by Higginson – then walkd to P.O. then to J. Brooks. Saw a Mrs Lee pf Bos. who knows Mrs Atkinon —
55° at 7 mong—
Pleasant but cool coldest day of the season
I at home from want of strength to go to Chh.
Rainy – Mrs Ben left in 7–40 coach for Worcestr and Lancastr

Pleasant day – Cattle Show + Gala day for Farmers + their families — I went to the Hall to see the vegetables– Walkd don the Brooks Hill – first time since Sept. 1. What I walkd so far – taken sick 2d – not so strong as July 3d when I first walkd down . a MrGeorge Woodward from Worcester came at E (George)
Rose early + wrote Mrs Bean + Will&ddotlow; ea a few times –
Mrs Beane cam at Eve. Dr Neh. Adams + Daugher annie cam in 2 1/2 Train – –
Changed to cooler in P.M–
Cold and disagreebe
Mr Geo. Woodwards Mother came in P.M. to look after Son – He is feeble.
Very windy + cold. I walkd down Brooks Hill but came hom tired. a disagreble day – –
Rainy till P.M. when it held up so Mrs B. + I walked —
It is cold + uncomfortable — outside also in my room 55°dotlow; Find it pleasant in the parlor –
Eve. the Misses Adams sewg with Mrs Bean.
Milder to our great joy – Dr Adams not well –
I took a walk to Cemetery – too long.
Sunny + cool
I took only Short walk. Dr Adams Som better. P.M. Mrs Bean wnt for Maidn Hair Roots
Sunny but cold–
George Woodward left for his home in Worcester –
Left Princeton for Uxbridge after nearly 3 mos. stay in Mr Howards family – Mrs B. + I went to Sis. Mary's
I staid from Chh – Rainy day – Mrs Bean went –
Pleasant – Sis. Margaret came– and passd the day–
5 Tran P.M. Mrs Ban + Mary A Chapin started for N.Y. Mary Enrout for Atlanta Ga. at Eve Bro. Judson came,
Judson, Will&ddotlow; + Lawson Prepa fr auction of Adols Effects –
Sister Mary vry feeble –
I left Uxbridge in 8–20 Train for Home – Stopd at Pawtucket – + on getting into Cars found Mrs Ben reting. fr N.Y. Maggie cam at noon —
We are trying to get unpacked. It is but little I I can do —.
Pleasant – I wnt to Chh. for first tim since July 1874 in our Chh. A great joy to be there again a Mr Timmon preached –
I went to Taunton with G.W.W. to see Judge Bennt about Adol. Will.
Mr Wild left at Eve for Newark for vacation 2 wks
Mrs Briggs here washing windows
Warm + pleasant Adams began cutting down trees in grove —
Mrs Bean drove out —
Mrs Briggs here cleanig Blinds + Windows –
Cloudy + raw — I bal&ddotlow; &account;
Powerful rain last night + this forenoon – P.M. it held up – Men cleaning pass ways – at 4 Mrs B. + I drv out —
Mr Craig push I went out only in the morng.
Cloudy + some rainy – Mrs B. went with me to New Bedford + ret&ddotlow; at 1/4 of 5 –
Bro. Judson + little Jack cam out while I was away –
I went to the stor + Signed Deeds for Adol Est –
Mr Rogersn called + brot me the state of Semy. funds
Sister Mary cam this morng. at 10 1/2 from Ux –.
Wheaton Wheeler died at 12 last night after a shot sicknes – disease of the heart – 82 years old — He was full of pm
Pleasant – Sis– May, Mrs Bean + I went to Chh. in the morng. a Mr Timmon preached. at noon I went to see Eliza Wheeler
Sent Mrs Bean in the morng. to Mansfield for flowers for Mr Wheeler at one went to funeral – was vry tired –
Mr Emerson came at noon to See about Winter St. Est– –
Mrs B. went with me to Taunton to Burt + Kings Marbl factory + to Banks
Pleasant–
Geo. Lizzie + Alfred ret&ddotlow; from their vacation in forenoon
P.M. at 4 call&ddotlow; on Mrs Tripp —
Pleasant – walked to Eliza Wheelers af Breakfast –
Pleasant – Bro. Judson came out with little Minn + we look&ddotlow; over Adol.s Estate matters Mary Sister rode 4 times to Depot – Mrs Beane went to Charlestown for me — + She attendd concert
We had Mr Timn preach – John 14=&th; 6
Sister Mary quite feeble –
Work of cutting down grove still going on –
I get out to P. office + attend to matters
Pleasant – Out to cottage – Saw about pears – Went to Mr Rogersn and left a Donations for Seminy fund –
Mrs Bean went to Semy. to Concert
Very high wind about 2 + 3,o'clk – Sister came to my room there –
Cleard off – Mrs Brigg cleaning up – Maggie's man cam
Mrs Metcalf calld
Pleasant —
Bro. Willd came in 10 1/4 Train —
P.M. Mrs B. + I calld at Mrs Gregory + then at E. Wheelers + I calld at Chloe's —
Cloudy –
Misses Mellus + Carter in to See Sister —
P.M. Bro. Will&ddotlow; drve to Taunton with Geo.
Raw chilly, cloudy day –
Mr Gowan + Danl. S. Cobb calld on busins
Alfred Tubbs came in 3 Train–
A Mr Houghton preached Text Jhn. 13– wht thou knowst now thou shalt know her after
Raw + windy May, Will&ddotlow; + Alfred all left for Bos. in the 8–20 Train – after Sis. had been here nearly 3 wks.
Still cold + blowy – Mr Wild went to Boston on my business –
Election day – I had two walks
Milder + pleasant – I busy about Sundry things till 20 – of 11 when I walked – a letter from Willd from W.R. Sister Mary more comfortable –
Raw cloudy day morng. went with Mrs Ban to Mrs Adams to see her new house –
P.M. called at Hotel + Bd. hou —
Mrs B. + I went to Taunton – Bot carpet for Jos. Adam + wife's new House. Got vry tired —
Pleasant
Mary Sweet calld – Mrs B. Misses Mellus + Carter went to Mansfield in P.M.
I went to Chh P.M. Com. Seasn Rev Mr Sherman preached —
Pleasant — I am feeling not well as usual –
Found out it was tea that was making my my lims tremmly
Pleasant – Bro. Judsn + little Johnny came in Early Train – I sittled Trustee &account; with J. + he left at 11 for Ux. + home that – Eveg.
a letter from Mr Emerson telling of an offer for Winter St Est
House warming at Jos. Adams
Am feeling worn from Excitement of yesterday – Have heard of Sis. Mary's ill taken at W. Rox
Pleasant – called on Mrs Trask at Miss Carter's –
Pleasant – I took a drive with Blky and for the first time since Sept. 1. 1874 had the reains
We found Mr Emerson at the Dep. He came to see me about Winter St. Est. Wm. L. Jackson here to tell us of the death of Mrs West
Morng I drov Blky to Poor Fans + around "Swift Corner hourne with Mrs Bean– then calld on Mrs Ed Payson– P.M. calle&ddotlow; at Mrs Ed. Freeman's–
Cloudy + threatenig – Sent for + Sent home Mrs Knowles for Chh I went out in fornon a young + good Mr Stone preached – Enter in at the strait gate +c. Raind this P.M. + Eve –

Cloudy + almost drizzly –Wm. L. Jackson here to dine – P.M. Mrs West's remains were buried at Center Cemetery– The Jacksons + Annie West here to luch after the burial — a letter from Cynthia + M.A. to C –
Cloudy drizzly forenoon + P.M. rainy – I out to store + office — P.M. wrote Beuvais + C. + Mr Emerson.
The wind blew all last night + to day. Mrs Bean been very sick with Headack – Cold uncomfortable day – + I feeling weak jonted –
Cold – clear – I went to office, Wildes + Cottg in forenoon – at 3 1/2 drove out with Miss Mellus – Had headache – Eve. alone in the House– Mrs Ban gone to Semiy Entertainment –
Went to Bos. with Mrs Beane + out in 3 Train – Less fatigue than any time since I was sick –
Busy in morng. about dusting + then at my Desk – then to P. Office P.M. after a rest drove 2 hours with Mrs B. Anni Emerson + Elane Deb. Anie retd to tea –
Cloudy forenoon + I went to Chh. Mr Stone S text in James 1–12–good — Began to rain about 1. P.M. – Maggie wnt to her Chh. + got wet –
Windy – Maggie washd
P.M. in 3 train Mr Emerson + + Mr Allen + Bro from Boston came to see me about Winter St. Est –
Alfred + Freddy Swett brot me some ground pins – + did some chores for me – I got very tired — P.M. it rained hard – I expected Mr Emerson but he did not come

Pleasant – I busy in forenoon – after dinn made Eve green hangsuy for picture– Mr Emerson came at 3 Train + ret&ddotlow; at 1/4 of 5 Tran about Bos. Est. Florn cam at 5 1/2 – Mrs Jetters Had to day paralyitic attack –
Mr W went to Taunton
Thanksgivin Lovely day – Mrs B. + I went to Mrs Hunt in the morng. + calld on C. Braman –
P.M. after Thankg dinnr + a rest– we drove round Barrowsvill + Jewellry Shop
A letter fr. Bro. Austin telling of Sam. F. Chapins misfortunes –
Pleasant – drove in the morng. with Mrs B + Florence –
Flor. left for Wor. in the 2 Train
A package of paper by Annie Em on W. Estate —
Pleasant – went to Chh in forenn + heard Rev. C.J.H.Ropes what shall it profit a man +c – 2 verses– very interestg
Cold + windy–
Mr Emerson came at Eve + brot the proposals –
Mr Wild P.M. went to Taunton
Very cold —
Geo. went to Boston to get Briggs a great coat – + other Errand– Mr Emrson also left in the morng.
Did not get out I think—
Very cold –
Walkd + to Mrs Hunt's in foren with Mrs Bean walked again just before dark
Still very cold – I wrote Bro. Austn + sent 200. Draft to Sam. F. Chapin went to P.O. at 2 P.M. then nappd while in bed Mr Will Payson + wife called– I walkd again after nap.
a letter from Sis. Marg.
Pleasant but cold – Mr Emern came at 3,o'clk. + brot draft of lease — + letters to be read —
Mr E spends the night —

Mr E. left this mong at 8–20 train + Geo.left at 11–20 for Bos. to take turkish bath – Mrs Bean quite sick in forenoon but able to get down to dinner – + walkd, just as sunset– I called on Mrs Metcalf + told her Ann E.'s Parents did not wish her to retun
Cloudy
Went to Chh. in the morng. Mr Stone preached – read the prodigal's return + text 119 PSl– 59&th;v. —
Mrs B. went to an Evg. meeting.
Mrs B. + I went to Taunton to get my Bonnet rep&ddotlow;
Mr R. + Rev. Mr Stone calld
Very tired but went to Boston + out at 2 Train –
Mrs Emerson came in to tea – from Bd. H. Sofa Freeman is there sick with scarlet fever —
Threatenig weather but Mrs B. + I went to Boston + shopd till 2 Train –
Mr Emerson cam about Lease and Mrs E came from Bd. H. + passd night with him —
Mr E. left this morg We drove out in forenoon – Mrs E. here to Dine – Lucy Howard + Hattie Gregory here to tea – MissesMellus Carter, Ellen Carpenter + Mrs Wm. Carpenter called also Mr Rogerson
School disbanded for a fortnight's vacation –

Mrs Bean headache + at home – I went to Chh. P.M. a Mr Thurston from Hall Chh. Raynham preached – Text John 13–23– Disciple leaning on Jesus bosom – very interesting – Vote taken to call Mr Stone as acting Pastor 23 for 4 vs.
I wrote note to Mr Rogersn
Trustees met at Bd. House P.M. They acted on the matter of my giving a long lease of Winter St. Estate
Mrs Beane went to Boston for me + ret&ddotlow; at Eve.
Cloudy damp Mng I drove out with Mrs Bean + Mary Wild round Jewelry Shop — MrsB Headache – P.M. Mary Wild went with me to Hattie Willis' + Mrs Sanford's —
Very cold + windy – Mrs Beane went to to Taunton 8 3/4 + back at 11–20– Mr Rogerson called
P.M. E. Wheeler called – I rode in the morng. to Depot + to Bridget's + walk just at dark
Severe day on act. of cold + wind – I went to chh. in forenoon – a little Mr Garden preached – Text John 4&th;– 13,14 v– on the waters of life + cravings of the Soul –
7,o'clk 2° a.0.Evg.
10 b.0 Early–
Severely cold — all day –
Maggie washed + Briggs put out clothes –
Lovely day –
Wether moderating fast –
P.M. We looked over list for Bostn
Eve. a letter from Boston Austin
Mrs B. + I went to Boston – I came out at 2 I was so tired + she staid till 4–35— – + came home lame with her foot –
Cold clear day – Mrs B. + I drove to Mr Copelands new house in Mansfield – Mrs B. quite lame –
Mr Emerson came at 3 P.M. about lease –
Raw wind
Mrs Metcalf rode with me to Bown Wetherels – Mr Emers left in the morng – Florence came at Eve –
Snowed. in the Eve. We had no tree at Chh–
Drizzly day – 2 or 3 ins snow – I sent Mr Wild to Taunton to see Dr Blake– I recd. a letter from Mr Emerson –
Maggy here instead of going home
Mild but cloudy Floren + I went to Chh. morng. + heard Rev . Text 2 Cor. 9–15– Gift of Christ – I was interested in his Exercises–
Rode to Bowen Wetherll with Briggs – after nap P.M. called at Geo.'s who has been sick all day + last night after this call walked up + down the walk for frish air —

Walked in morng. to Grave Yard with wreaths for Mr Bean Mr + Mrs Wests gravs – At noon Alf. Emen cam – Dr Blake at 2 – at 3 Alex Stowell + Alex S. Porter came and a lease of Winter St. I gave to Alex Stowll for 15 yrs –
Mr Emerson left this morng. Florenc went to Foxboro. + back at noon – Mrs B. + I drove in mong. with Briggs —
Mrs Metcalf in at Eve.
Drizzly day –
Mr Wild drove Jim to Taunton to get Sundries –
P.M. I went to see Geo. R. Perry about asst. of property – Had conversation in the morng. about Jennie Mam +c—
Clouds lifted –Mrs Beane + Florence left for Boston at 8 – Mrs B. to go to Dr Monroe for a lame foot she has had some 10 days – She stays till tomorr – Flor. goes to Wor–She has been here a week –
Mrs Ben Briggs here sweeping – Geo. W.W. went to Taunton for me this P.M.
This Eve is a sociable at the vestry –
The moments of the old year is closing I thank God for all his mercies –

text.back:
Memoranda
at Clifton Springs read Hope Leslie by Miss Sedgwick —
3d Vol. Rise. Dutch Repbic The Old Mans' Selles Secret – a translation from Ger. by Mrs A.L. Wistn —
Some – "from my study window" by Lowell – "Italy"– by J.S.C.Abbott
+ 3 vols by Motly on the Netherlands
Bro. Adol. died 19&th; of June about 3 1/2, o'clk P.M. – He was taken with paralysis of the brain on Friday morng. of 11&th;– and has been a great suffer since first taken
I came to Ux. on the 12&th; and Still here – His funeral occur&ddotlow; on Tues. 22&draise;– Judson + Ema both persnt –
Wheaton Allen died Aug. 23. at 6,o'clk in the morng. at his Father's in Hanover Mass.
Rev Mr Atkinson (Tim.) died Tuesday 5,o clk June 29&th; + funeral on Friday 2d July – Remains carried into Chh. and there taken to Mt. Aurbun or Forest Hills for burial –
Memoranda
Rosy Willis died
Mrs Morrey
Ellyn Brigg
Mrs Tim. Smith
Wheaton Wheeler died Oct. 15 –1875 of disea of the heart – full of peace – 82 yrs old –
Memoranda
1875 November
Mrs Wm. A West died at Boston Highlands on the P.M. of 11&th;– of disea of the heart – age 73 yrs 9 mos. 21 days
Her remains were brot to Norton on Monday 15&th; for burial– The friends came here after the burial —
Mr Palmer died 15&th; Nov. after long suffering –
&ebwdiaback;
